title: Dickman function
summary: In analytic number theory, the Dickman function or Dickman–de Bruijn function ρ is a special function used to estimate the proportion of smooth numbers up to a given bound. It was first studied by actuary Karl Dickman, who defined it in his only mathematical publication,[1] which is not easily available,[2] and  later studied by the Dutch mathematician Nicolaas Govert de Bruijn.[3][4]
